metadata.title: A single holiday was the turning point of the COVID-19 policy of Israel

abstract.text: The impact of COVID-19 has been profound, and the public health challenge 44 seem to be the most serious regarding respiratory viruses since the 1918 H1N1 45 influenza pandemic. In the absence of effective vaccine or biomedical treatment, the 46 basic rules of public health measures have not changed, namely public distancing. 47

body_text.text: We analyzed epidemiological investigation reports during the first month of 49 the outbreak in Israel. In addition, we present a deterministic compartment model and 50 simulations of several scenarios emphasizing quarantine and isolation policies given 51 their efficiency. 52

We identify an abrupt change from controlled epidemic regime to an 54 exponential growth (ܴ ൌ 2.19) in light of the actual policy-makers decisions and 55 public behavior in Israel. Our analysis show that before the abrupt change, the new 56 cases trend was due to returning citizens infected abroad. The abrupt change followed 57 a holiday in which social distancing was clearly inefficient and many public 58 gatherings were held. We further discuss three different modeled scenarios of 59 quarantine efficiency: high-, medium-, and low-efficiency. 60

FIGREF0.text: of spread of epidemics as well as the quarantine-isolation policy 98 of Israel was modeled using the SEQIJR model (e.g. Gumel, et al., 2004). This is a 99 deterministic compartmental model which allows the implicit inclusion of biological 100 epidemiological phases (including incubation period) as well as governmental 101 interventions such as quarantine and their actual efficiency of implementation. A 102 successful a posteriori implementation of this model to the transmission dynamics and 103 control of the SARS epidemics in Toronto, Hong Kong, Singapore and Beijing is 104 given in Gumel, et al., 2004. The model consists of a system of 7 dynamical equations 105 and 15 parameters. For details of the model and its parameters see the online 106 supplementary information. 107

A week later, a passenger from Italy was 188 diagnosed as a COVID-19 patient, and Italy was added to the list of countries that 189 require 14 days quarantine. 190The quarantine-isolation policy succeeded in keeping the rate of daily new 191 cases small, up until March 9 th . Then, 4 days later, a sudden change of regime has 192 occurred, which was manifested by the distinct change of the epidemic curve of Israel 193 towards exponential growth. March 15 th marks the first time that the daily new cases 194 of locally infected were higher than the new travel associated cases. 195The timing of this abrupt change is not of coincidence. Regarding the cases 196 arriving from abroad, a requirement for home quarantine affecting all travelers 197 arriving began on Match 9 th . Moreover, during the period between March 9 th to 11 th a 198 Jewish holiday, Purim, was celebrated. This holiday is characterized by big parades 199 organized by local municipalities, as well as religious gatherings and privately 200 organized parties. Although authorities cancelled the public parades, many privately 201 organized and religious crowding had occurred. Regrettably, these drove Israel from a 202 controlled, mitigated regime to an exponential growth, as described in the results 203 section.
